history.content: No. Please review many similar questions on here. If you discussion is full, there is no seat for you to enroll into.

children.subject: This new Cal Central enrollment system is incredibly frustrating and unfair to students, especially those who followed department guidelines and wait listed early in phase 2 to ensure a preferential spot on course wait lists.

I'm not sure if this still works, but last semester I managed to switch my section for a waitlisted class (CS70) by clicking "Add" (under the "Enrollment Options"), and selecting the section I wanted to switch into. The system then automatically swapped my sections. Not sure if this is the right way to switch sections for waitlisted classes or just a really hacky solution, but it worked for me.

My situation may have been slightly different, though. I did this really late into adjustment period when they were letting everyone in, so priority wasn't a thing, and the section I switched into had empty seats and no waitlist.

Also keep in mind that your position on the overall lecture waitlist doesn't matter too much - it matters more where you are on the waitlist for your discussion. Last semester I Phase 1'd CS70 (I was waitlisted b/c I was CoC at the time) and I was hovering around #10 on the lecture waitlist for the entirety of adjustment period, even when they had let about 200 students into the class. Sadly, CalCentral doesn't tell you your position on your section waitlist, but if you make an appointment with one of the L&S CS advisors they can see your section waitlist position.

Hopefully this helped, I'm sorry this happened to you. CalCentral is a bit of a pain to deal with as is but maybe in the future things will be a little less convoluted.
Also apparently "Options" lets you switch sections without dropping, not sure if this only works for enrolled classes or if it also works on waitlisted ones.

But if I drop from the wait list and re-add then I will have no chance of getting in as I'll end up at the bottom of the wait list. I know my section was open when I originally added to the wait list, so it's not my fault that it is wait listed now. Can't the department address this issue by manually enrolling students from the wait list into open sections?

history.content: I'm a non-major on the waitlist for CS 170 and CS 186 in positions 42 and 77, respectively. However, I'm waitlisted for discussions that are full and CalCentral won't allow me to swap the discussion I'm wait listed for. Will I still be able to enroll directly now that adjustment period has started?
history.subject: Waitlist During Adjustment Period
